data.title: _input() of a Node2D is processed before "pressed" signal handlers of a Button
data.body: The _input() of a Node2D with input processing enabled seems to processed before any "pressed" signal handlers of a Button, the documentation at https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/wiki/tutorial_input_events suggests that GUI widgets handle input first before calling any _input() handlers.

data.title: Make it possible to serialize objects through GDScript
data.body:
According to that page: https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/wiki/binary_Serialization , it is possible to serialize vars only when reading/writing from a file, and when sending over PacketPeer.

It would be nice if it is possible to convert a RawArray (or String) to var and back, for some applications like Compressed Protocols, (strange) Game Save Formats,  etc.

data.title: Camera2D zoom & smoothing problem
data.body:
When the camera2D is moving and the zoom is updated, the camera movement makes a "stop" and then continues. Note this only occurs when using a smoothing factor other than 0.

I'm using dynamic changes in the camera properties using the Tween class and this is very noticeable. I don't know if this only applies to zoom only or other properties as well.

I include a test project: https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/274954519/bugZoom2D.zip
Use LEFT-RIGHT to move and 1, 2, 3 to set the zoom.
Notice how the speed of the camera changes, even when setting the same zoom multiple times. Also, everything seems to work fine if the smoothing is 0

data.title: Realtime audio filtering (lowpass, highpass, bandpass)
data.body:
Hi!

Is it possible to perform simple audio processing in realtime in Godot?

This could have many uses like effects of being underwater or stunned.

Every piece of realtime audio manipulation saves storage capacity needed for games - as some effects can be used to alter the sound samples without storing additional copies of them.

data.title: Interpolation for affine transformations/Bound rot/pos Matrix32 constructor
data.body: I figured out the problem I was having: it was a problem with the test code and not with the submission. Anyway, I cleaned it up a bit (changed floats to real_t).

data.title: Interpolation for affine transformations/Bound rot/pos Matrix32 constructor
data.body: Both changes have been tested. The affine interpolation works at least as well as my GDScript version.

data.title: Animation player set_steps fix
data.body: Fixes this https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/issues/1264

data.title: [1.1][bug] User signals don't work if defined in ready()
data.body:
Defining signal in ready() with `add_user_signal()` don't work. They need to be added in `_init()`.
Minimal working example:https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/168251/godot/some/issues/UserSignals.7z

data.title: ColorRamp new features
data.body:
- hold alt and left-click to duplicate color
- hold shift while grabbing the color node to snap selected one to the nearest one (if close enough)

![animation](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6615905/8099041/d6cc87be-0ff7-11e5-8812-0b0bae2672e7.gif)

data.title: Segfault when running godot-tools on LXLE (Linux)
data.body:
Whenever I try running godot-tools on my netbook running LXLE I get a segfault error. (LXLE is based on Ubuntu/Lubuntu's LTS version, currently 14.04.) GDB backtrace follows:

(gdb) run
Starting program: /home/ando/Downloads/godot_x11-1.1stable.64 
[Thread debugging using libthread_db enabled]
Using host libthread_db library "/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libthread_db.so.1".
warning: the debug information found in "/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/dri/radeon_dri.so" does not match "/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/dri/i915_dri.so" (CRC mismatch).

[New Thread 0x7fffe9b66700 (LWP 7574)]
[New Thread 0x7fffe9365700 (LWP 7575)]
[New Thread 0x7fffe92f8700 (LWP 7576)]

Program received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
0x0000000000000000 in ?? ()
(gdb) bt
#0  0x0000000000000000 in ?? ()
#1  0x0000000000502e03 in RasterizerGLES2::init() ()
#2  0x0000000000f6c3c0 in VisualServerRaster::init() ()
#3  0x0000000000f2c0e0 in VisualServerWrapMT::init() ()
#4  0x0000000000413f3e in OS_X11::initialize(OS::VideoMode const&, int, int) ()
#5  0x0000000000416e7e in Main::setup2() ()
#6  0x0000000000418ebd in Main::setup(char const_, int, char_*, bool) ()
#7  0x000000000040ef7a in main ()

**UPDATE:**
I tried running godot-tools on a live setup of Manjaro (based on Arch Linux) on the same netbook, and the game worked. I guess the problem lies with my setup then, not with Godot.

data.title: [Crash] framebuffer_shrink = 0
data.body:
If set Project Settings>rasterizer>framebuffer_shrink = 0 Godot Crash.
Tested on Linux and Windows 8.1

data.title: Shift key not registered on Macs
data.body:
I'm getting reports from Mac users that their shift keys are not being recognized in my Godot game. All other keys work fine but the Shift key is never registered as being pressed, neither in the game nor when rebinding controls in the options menu. The game doesn't seem to notice the player is pressing anything at all.

Issue reported for OSX Mavericks (10.9). Since I don't own a Mac I unfortunately can't do any testing myself but I can contact the players if more information is needed.

data.title: RigidBody sleeping after collision
data.body:
Hi, I'm having a weird result with a very basic scene. I'm making a roll-a-ball game with Godot. Basically, i have a floor (StaticBody) and a sphere (RigidBody). When the scene start my sphere fall on the floor but when i try to apply velocity nothing happen. Actually, if i apply velocity BEFORE the sphere hit the floor, it's working. It is not because of friction (i tried with extremly high number and +Y velocity still nothing).

Weirdly, if I turn off "can sleep" on my sphere everything works.

If I understand correctly, for some reason when my sphere hit the floor the RigidBody start sleeping. Ok, fine i can live with that. 

But, when i explicitly apply force to that object the RigidBody I expect the RigidBody to wake up.

data.title: Z sorting of Sprite3D misbehaving for orthogonal camera
data.body:
I have a problem with Sprite3D in relation to camera position.
All the objects in my levels are Sprite3D and the camera is in orthogonal mode and can not rotate. In most cases this looks good. 
But with the walls and hedges, where some Sprite3D are overlapping there is a problem (Z ordering?), when said sprites are in the corners of the camera. Suddenly they misbehave and are displayed in the wrong order.
This problem can be seen in the video at 1:33 in the bottom right corner.
Is there anything I can do about that?

https://youtu.be/K70x3WegT8Y?t=90

data.title: Adapt 2d physics layer system for 3d
data.body: Im working in a 3d project and I need to filter the characters inside an Area node to apply or not the gravity. So, making use of a similar layer system that already exist in the 2d side would do the trick.

data.title: Sprite3D disappear in the editor view
data.body:
Hey guys,

I found a big sprite3D bug in Godot 1.1 stable. If I create a new sprite3D, add a texture (see picture 1) and translate, rotate or scale it, the sprite3D disappear in the editor view (see picture 2). Sometimes it disappear very fast, sometimes it takes a little time. If you play the project the sprite3D is back in the play view but not in the editor view.

I could reproduce the bug on my pc with Kubuntu 14.04 and an Nvidia graphic card and on my laptop with Windows 7 and an Intel graphic card.

P.S. In Godot 1.0 stable everything works fine.

![sprite3d1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11014216/8075042/5c302e14-0f3b-11e5-8314-3c2ced1a430e.JPG)
![sprite3d2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11014216/8075043/5d741fb0-0f3b-11e5-9a23-df4f3b57cad1.JPG)

data.title: Tween speed
data.body: I'm using Tween quite offen in my work. But to be honest, I'm not quite sure what does the "set_speed" really stands for - which is crusial. Ok - it makes it faster or slower but I cant find what is the unit here. Wouldn't it be better to change the approach here and swap it with something like "set_tween_time/lengh" or "set_duration" in seconds/miliseconds ? It would be much more intuitive and self documentating.

data.title: add bind method for create_from_fnt (load fnt made by BMFont)
round(), int() returns incorrect value
Added rot/pos constructor for Matrix32 variant.
The "Items" menu for MenuButton objects is missing.
data.body: In Godot 1.0 stable, there was an "Items" button when you select a MenuButton (#1079). It used to allow editing of MenuButton items on the editor but now it's gone. Please put it back in.

data.title: duplicate animationPlayer
data.body:
I have new scene look like : 

-Node2D
--Sprite
--AnimationPlayer -> with 1 track to animate the sprite

Then duplicating : 

-Node2D
--Sprite
--Sprite1
--AnimationPlayer
--AnimationPlayer1

When i change the AnimationPayer1 track source (Sprite/pos -> Sprite1/pos)
1st animationPlayer track source is also changed.

I need more thn one animationPlayer to run autoplay together (one autoplay at given time).

data.title: Small fix for Import Game dialog labels
Scale go back to original size if node is Rigidbody (1.1)
data.body:
I can't change the scale of the snowball if it has or is a Rigidbody. It scales always to the original size. 
But when I change the RigidBody to a StaticBody or KinematicBody scaling works.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10463138/8041234/030cb3ea-0e17-11e5-8891-ad8029396be9.png)

data.title: Fixed get_packet/put_packet bindings in PacketPeer.
data.body: These changes have been tested and appear to be working as intended.

data.title: Splitting editor tabs
data.body: Allow spliting tabs - to view two ( or more ) different scripts, scenes and so on at the same time, both horizontal and vertical. Also multiple times something like in blender.

data.title: [Feature Request] H/V separation in GridContainer
data.body:
For now, GridContainer has `Separation` which makes a horizontal and vertical gap with same value.
But it would be great if GridContainer has H/V separation.

data.title: Control/Anchor-Ratio not working from the inspector
data.body: The inspector doesn't allow float input, that way the ratio can only be an integer value. That way setting the ratio only works via script.

data.title: fixes #2046 for custom themed buttons not working with pressed/focused action.
data.body:
+Fixes #2046 
+Added DRAW_FOCUSED and related necessary changes.
+Some formatting clean-ups.
+Tested working on x11 x84-64 Linux Mint 17 Qiana 14.04.2 LTS. 
  AMD R280 Open source driver
